intro: Aldasorea saundersii, commonly known as the Saunders' alders, is a species of flowering plant in the family Betulaceae. It is characterized by its small, oval leaves and clusters of yellowish-green catkins. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in temperate regions. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
